channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023080588
item.description:
Report X-2023080588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found leaking in unload and QA was alerted. DescribePack: One of the 4 containers was missing a cap and another had a cap very loose and leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA used gloves and a hazmat container to remove the hazmat from the unload. Absorbent material was used to soak up the spill and was swept up into the hazmat container.

item.title: Report E-2023080193
item.description:
Report E-2023080193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NDE experienced a UN1263 Cycon UV-HighGloss Monolyer 757-4F release from a 5-gallon steel pail due to improper loading. XPO terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release with granular absorbents. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080068
item.description:
Report E-2023080068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a UN3266 Zep Concentrated Driveway and Concrete Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting the trailer floor and cardboard box due to a fork blade puncture. The crew advised the release evaporated and there was no product to clean off of the floor of the trailer. The damaged jug and impacted cardboard were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining cargo was re-secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080166
item.description:
Report E-2023080166

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of the cleaner/degreaser (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly one gallon jugs had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080140
item.description:
Report E-2023080140

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon pails of primer (un3295) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
